availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jonathan Tyson (Gallatin County, Kentucky, painter and justice of the peace)

body.p: Gallatin County, Kentucky, painter and justice of the peace. Pennsylvania native. Married to Frances Ann Oliver Tyson in Gallatin County, Kentucky, on May 31, 1838. Father of Martha Tyson Stodghill, William Tyson, Oliver Tyson, Jennie Tyson, and Alice Tyson. Farmer in Owen County, Kentucky, in 1840. Owned one enslaved person in Owen County in 1840. Painter in Gallatin County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Gallatin County in 1862. Died in Gallatin County on March 31, 1865.

ab.bibl:
